page.title: 03FARMING-LT.GADDESDEN AREA
page.content: Lt.Gaddesden and Ringshall is generally open farming. The farmers mostly put cattle on fields. The commonest cows are Friesans and Herefords;they cross breed sometimes.They are bred for beef not so much dairy products. Crops are seen everywhere. These include Oats, Barley, Wheat and also Oil seed rape.Some farmers breed pheasants and they let them go and shoot them. We have no grouse in this area.Some farmers have turkeys or chickens. Some of them have little farms.The amount of acreage starts at about 25 acres,the medium size farm is 15O acres,the farms have up to 6OO acres. Farmers are using modern implemts not the old machinery. Modern machinery does the job better and faster.And large tractors are for the large fields
